description: From Middle English fastenen, from Old English fæstnian, from Proto-West Germanic *fastinōn (“to secure, fasten”). Equivalent to fast +‎ -en.

verbs.description: fasten (third-person singular simple present fastens, present participle fastening, simple past and past participle fastened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To attach or connect in a secure manner.
examples: The sailor fastened the boat to the dock with a half-hitch.
Can you fasten these boards together with some nails?

entries.meaning: To cause to take close effect; to make to tell; to land.
